bibl.title: Response to Elio Lo Cascio.

series.title: Oxford Studies on the Roman Economy

bibl.note: Why did Egypt have more centres with populations greater than 20,000 than Italy, with also a high organization rate and a population probably on the same order of magnitude?

bibl.title: Quantifying the Roman Economy. Methods and Problems

bibl.seg: LO CASCIO Elio, Urbanization as a Proxy of Demographic and Economic Growth; - Roger BAGNALL, Response to Elio Lo Cascio.
Alan BOWMAN and Andrew WILSON (Edd.), Quantifying the Roman Economy. Methods and Problems = Oxford Studies on the Roman Economy (Oxford, 2009) pp. 87-106; - 107-112.
Why did Egypt have more centres with populations greater than 20,000 than Italy, with also a high organization rate and a population probably on the same order of magnitude?
